headings.name: Overview
headings.description:
TFJS Task API groups models into different tasks. To use a specific model, you first need to load it, then call the predict method on the model to run the inference.

Load model

To load a model, use a model loader as follows. Do not construct the model manually.

const model = await tfTask.{task_name}.{model_name}.{runtime}.load(options);

Please refer to a specific model below for details about the exact model loader to use and the corrsponding options.

Run inference

All loaded models have a predict method defined. Call it with model-specific input and options to get the inference result. Please refer to a specific model below for details about the input and the corresponding options.

const result = await model.predict(input, options);

Clean up resources

All loaded models have a cleanUp method defined to clean up resources. The model should not be used after this call.

model.cleanUp();

headings.name: Image Classification
headings.description: The task of classifying images into a preset of labels.

symbols.documentation: The base class for all ImageClassification task models.

parameters.name: img
parameters.documentation: The image-like element to run classification on.

parameters.name: options
parameters.documentation:
Inference options. Different models have different
inference options. See individual model for more details.

methods.documentation:
Performs classification on the given image-like input, and returns
result.

params.name: classes
params.documentation: All predicted classes.

params.name: className
params.documentation: The name of the class.

params.name: score
params.documentation: The score of the class.

params.name: model
params.documentation:
The model url, or the model content stored in an `ArrayBuffer`.

You can use TFLite model urls from `tfhub.dev` directly. For model
compatibility, see comments in the corresponding model class.

params.name: maxResults
params.documentation:
Maximum number of top scored results to return. If < 0, all results will
be returned. If 0, an invalid argument error is returned.

params.name: scoreThreshold
params.documentation:
Score threshold in [0,1), overrides the ones provided in the model metadata
(if any). Results below this value are rejected.

params.name: numThreads
params.documentation:
The number of threads to be used for TFLite ops that support
multi-threading when running inference with CPU. num_threads should be
greater than 0 or equal to -1. Setting num_threads to -1 has the effect to
let TFLite runtime set the value.

Default to number of physical CPU cores, or -1 if WASM multi-threading is
not supported by user's browser.

params.name: backend
params.documentation: The backend to use to run TFJS models. Default to 'webgl'.

params.name: topK
params.documentation: Number of top classes to return.

params.name: version
params.documentation:
The MobileNet version number. Use 1 for MobileNetV1, and 2 for
MobileNetV2. Defaults to 1.

params.name: alpha
params.documentation:
Controls the width of the network, trading accuracy for performance. A
smaller alpha decreases accuracy and increases performance. Defaults
to 1.0.

params.name: maxResults
params.documentation:
Maximum number of top scored results to return. If < 0, all results will
be returned. If 0, an invalid argument error is returned.

params.name: scoreThreshold
params.documentation:
Score threshold in [0,1), overrides the ones provided in the model metadata
(if any). Results below this value are rejected.

params.name: numThreads
params.documentation:
The number of threads to be used for TFLite ops that support
multi-threading when running inference with CPU. num_threads should be
greater than 0 or equal to -1. Setting num_threads to -1 has the effect to
let TFLite runtime set the value.

Default to number of physical CPU cores, or -1 if WASM multi-threading is
not supported by user's browser.

headings.name: Image Segmentation
headings.description: The task of predicting associated class for each pixel of an image.

symbols.documentation: The base class for all ImageSegmentation task models.

parameters.name: img
parameters.documentation: The image-like element to run segmentation on.

parameters.name: options
parameters.documentation:
Inference options. Different models have different
inference options. See individual model for more details.

methods.documentation:
Performs segmentation on the given image-like input, and returns
result.

params.name: width
params.documentation: The width of the returned segmentation map.

params.name: height
params.documentation: The height of the returned segmentation map.

params.name: segmentationMap
params.documentation:
The colored segmentation map as `Uint8ClampedArray` which can be
fed into `ImageData` and mapped to a canvas.

params.name: r
params.documentation: The red color component for the label, in the [0, 255] range.

params.name: g
params.documentation: The green color component for the label, in the [0, 255] range.

params.name: b
params.documentation: The blue color component for the label, in the [0, 255] range.

params.name: backend
params.documentation: The backend to use to run TFJS models. Default to 'webgl'.

params.name: numThreads
params.documentation:
The number of threads to be used for TFLite ops that support
multi-threading when running inference with CPU. num_threads should be
greater than 0 or equal to -1. Setting num_threads to -1 has the effect to
let TFLite runtime set the value.

Default to number of physical CPU cores, or -1 if WASM multi-threading is
not supported by user's browser.

params.name: model
params.documentation:
The model url, or the model content stored in an `ArrayBuffer`.

You can use TFLite model urls from `tfhub.dev` directly. For model
compatibility, see comments in the corresponding model class.

params.name: numThreads
params.documentation:
The number of threads to be used for TFLite ops that support
multi-threading when running inference with CPU. num_threads should be
greater than 0 or equal to -1. Setting num_threads to -1 has the effect to
let TFLite runtime set the value.

Default to number of physical CPU cores, or -1 if WASM multi-threading is
not supported by user's browser.

headings.name: Object Detection
headings.description: The task of localizing and identifing multiple objects in a single image.

symbols.documentation: The base class for all ObjectDetection task models.

parameters.name: img
parameters.documentation: The image-like element to detect objects on.

parameters.name: options
parameters.documentation:
Inference options. Different models have different
inference options. See individual model for more details.

methods.documentation: Detects objects on the given image-like input, and returns result.

params.name: objects
params.documentation: All detected objects.

params.name: boundingBox
params.documentation: The bounding box of the object.

params.name: className
params.documentation: The name of the class.

params.name: score
params.documentation: The score of the class.

params.name: originX
params.documentation: The X coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounding box.

params.name: originY
params.documentation: The Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounding box.

params.name: width
params.documentation: The width of bounding box.

params.name: height
params.documentation: The height of bounding box.

params.name: className
params.documentation: The name of the class.

params.name: score
params.documentation: The score of the class.

params.name: backend
params.documentation: The backend to use to run TFJS models. Default to 'webgl'.

params.name: maxNumBoxes
params.documentation:
The maximum number of bounding boxes of detected objects. There can be
multiple objects of the same class, but at different locations. Defaults
to 20.

params.name: minScore
params.documentation:
The minimum score of the returned bounding boxes of detected objects. Value
between 0 and 1. Defaults to 0.5.

params.name: maxResults
params.documentation:
Maximum number of top scored results to return. If < 0, all results will
be returned. If 0, an invalid argument error is returned.

params.name: scoreThreshold
params.documentation:
Score threshold in [0,1), overrides the ones provided in the model metadata
(if any). Results below this value are rejected.

params.name: numThreads
params.documentation:
The number of threads to be used for TFLite ops that support
multi-threading when running inference with CPU. num_threads should be
greater than 0 or equal to -1. Setting num_threads to -1 has the effect to
let TFLite runtime set the value.

Default to number of physical CPU cores, or -1 if WASM multi-threading is
not supported by user's browser.

params.name: model
params.documentation:
The model url, or the model content stored in an `ArrayBuffer`.

You can use TFLite model urls from `tfhub.dev` directly. For model
compatibility, see comments in the corresponding model class.

params.name: maxResults
params.documentation:
Maximum number of top scored results to return. If < 0, all results will
be returned. If 0, an invalid argument error is returned.

params.name: scoreThreshold
params.documentation:
Score threshold in [0,1), overrides the ones provided in the model metadata
(if any). Results below this value are rejected.

params.name: numThreads
params.documentation:
The number of threads to be used for TFLite ops that support
multi-threading when running inference with CPU. num_threads should be
greater than 0 or equal to -1. Setting num_threads to -1 has the effect to

Default to number of physical CPU cores, or -1 if WASM multi-threading is
